prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Geometric Shape with a Rectangular Base and a Triangular Top The first part of the CAD assembly is a three-dimensional geometric shape with a rectangular base and a triangular top. The top is slightly offset from the base, creating a sense of depth and perspective. The shape is symmetrical and has a smooth, matte finish. Creating the Coordinate System 1. Create a new coordinate system using the following Euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` - Translation Vector: `[0.0, 0.75, 0.0]` Drawing the 2D Sketch for Face 1 2. Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system created in step 1. 3. Draw five lines to form a closed loop: - Line 1: Start Point `[0.0, 0.0]`, End Point `[0.75, 0.0]` - Line 2: Start Point `[0.75, 0.0]`, End Point `[0.75, 0.75]` - Line 3: Start Point `[0.75, 0.75]`, End Point `[0.375, 0.75]` - Line 4: Start Point `[0.375, 0.75]`, End Point `[0.375, 0.375]` - Line 5: Start Point `[0.375, 0.375]`, End Point `[0.0, 0.0]` This loop forms the basis of the rectangular base and triangular top. Scaling the Sketch 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transforming the Sketch to 3D 5. Rotate the 2D sketch using the Z-axis rotation angle of -90 degrees (from the Euler Angles) and translate it according to the Translation Vector. Extruding the Sketch 6. Extrude the scaled and transformed 2D sketch along the Z-axis to create the final 3D model. The extrude depth should be 0.75 unit (`extrude_depth_towards_normal`). Additional Information The final dimensions of the part are: - Length: ~0.75 units - Width: ~0.75 units - Height: ~0.75 units The JSON representation of this intermediate CAD part contains all the information needed to create it. Follow this detailed step-by-step guide and the CAD model will be constructed accurately.</description>

Each loop is always closed. Next, scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model of the first part. Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.2935, and the extrusion depth opposite the normal to 0.0. The sketch scale is 0.75. The operation of this part with the previous body is a "NewBodyFeatureOperation", meaning that it results in the creation of a new solid body. **Part Dimensions** The length of this part is 0.75 units, the width is 0.75 units, and the height is 0.2935 units. The final shape of the CAD model is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism is centered on a white background. All parts are constructed according to this final shape.</description>
